title: Miss Fortune's latest Lore update as an argument for Pyke's agenda against Captains.
body:
https://imgur.com/LfW0apB

Current MF lore shows her striving to avoid ruling as viciously as GP did and warning Lucian about the empty finality of vengeance.

However, in the ongoing in-game event we are presented with a spotlight on MF when she was at her most ruthless. Her eyes reflect that same vicious look she wore when making her move against Gangplank.

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-k_0wtieGBf4/Va2naRUZf9I/AAAAAAAAt6U/oe9SghPy21g/s1600/cs_bg_champions%2B%25281%2529.png

I pondered why Riot is going backwards in regards to MF's timeline and eventually Riot Scathlocke's comments came to mind.

Riot Scathlocke made the point that this event was _all about Pyke_ and not necessarily Bilgewater. 

Pyke may be an unreliable narrator, but in the audio drama Lars did add validity to Pyke's story of being betrayed by his captain and left to die.

Pyke's tragedy is mirrored through MF's killing of an innocent and his "Gangplank affiliated" brother. One brother was drowned into the sea paralleling Pyke's doom, while the other brother was left to rot on the pier unburied, suggestive of Pyke's undead fate.

https://imgur.com/GlW6CYq

The artist goes through great lengths to almost cast MF as the villain in certain frames. Without any prior knowledge she would seem positioned as the antagonist, being centered on the right side of the frame and driving the action.

https://imgur.com/qM69LNO

Some folks asked why Riot would give more Miss Fortune lore as opposed to other Bilgewater legends. Pyke's dialogue "No more Captains" highlights his current focus on that class of Bilgewater above all else.

Of the two major lore Captains, Miss Fortune is typically expressed as the sympathetic character, thus featuring her at her worst holds more weight. Brothers are being murdered over a quarrel between Captains and our heroine is holding the smoking gun. 

My theory is that the purpose of this story is to unapologetically display some justification for Pyke's rationale "No more Captains".

https://lolstatic-a.akamaihd.net/frontpage/apps/prod/rg-champion-reveal-pyke-bloodharbor-ripper/en_US/04b473e458b975a3ca9569ae93715245406fee65/assets/img/content/wallpaper/base-splash.jpg

replies.body: Actually, Miss Fortune's color story, [Down Among the Dead Men](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/missfortune-color-story/), isn't new - only the illustrations are newly added.  I don't think it was as well known as some of the other stories.
MF seems to have a lot of stories and stuff connected to her. Would Down among the Dead men be one of the first, if not the first, stories chronologically?

I think the chronological order would be "Down Among the Dead Men", because she isn't wearing her captain outfit, "Burning Tides", then "Fortune Smiles" because of how ruthless she behaves against the other pirate lords, and then "Shadow and Fortune" that is when she starts changing her ways.

I believe the Burning Tides story comes first, then is likely either closely followed by "Down Among the Dead Men" or "Shadow and Fortune". Whichever of the latter two didn't come first certainly comes soon after the other.
Come on, that guy was hardly innocent.  You don't become one Gangplank's "sworn men" by helping the homeless and selling girl scout cookies.
